Title: Bright Star
Original title: Bright Star
Country: United Kingdom, Australia, France
USA release: 06/11/2009
Released in Spain: 03/09/2010
Released on DVD (rental): 12/01/2011
Genre: Drama, Romance
Length: 119 min.
Producer: Jan Chapman Pictures
Director: Jane Campion
Screenplay: Jane Campion
Cast: Ben Whishaw, Abbie Cornish, Kerry Fox, Paul Schneider, Edie Martin, Thomas Sangster, Gerard Monaco, Antonia Campbell-Hughes, Samuel Roukin, Amanda Hale, Lucinda Raikes, Samuel Barnett, Jonathan Aris, Olly Alexander, Theresa Watson
Rating: Suitable for all audiences

Synopsis:
London, 1818. Begins a secret affair between the young 23 year old English poet, John Keats (Ben Whishaw) and his neighbor, Fanny Brawne (Abbie Cornish), an outspoken and smart student. The atypical partner starts badly, he seeing her as a brash style, and she at all impressed not only by his poetry, but literature in general. However, when Fanny Keats discovers that taking care of his younger brother, gravely ill, he is shocked and asks him to teach you things about poetry, to which he agrees. Poetry becomes a romantic choice that works not only to resolve their differences, but to fuel a passionate romance.

When Fanny's alarmed mother and Keats' best friend discover the relationship, it is now unstoppable. Hard and hopelessly absorbed in each other, the young lovers are driven by powerful and new sensations. "I feel as if we are dissolving," wrote Keats. Then rode together in a wave of romantic obsession, but did not get stronger as their problems grew.

2009: Oscar: Nominated for Best Costume
2009: BAFTA: Nominated for Best Costume
2009: Cannes: Nominated for the Palme d'Or (best picture)
